text: making pink applesauce lets you skip the
tedious step of peeling the apples
because all the pretty pink color comes
from the skins you just leave the skins
on quarter the apples and ready to go I
have six pounds of apples here about
four pounds of McIntosh two pounds of
mccune any very red skin very white
flesh apple will give you the prettiest
sauce I'm almost done cutting all my
apples I like to just cut them in
quarters with a large chef's knife and
then use a paring knife to take out the
core just scoop out the core scoop out
the seeds all of these apples go into a
really large pot cook them down and then
why don't have cups of water this is
going to help the apples cook down and
last bit is lemon juice lemon is really
great to keep the color and to bring out
the flavor taste your apples your apples
are really tart you can add a little bit
of sugar
okay quarter cup of lemon juice I have a
little strainer to get the seeds into
the pot now this goes onto the stove put
the cover on go in and cook this down
okay I have my apples on the stove I'm
going to turn this on and bring the
water in there to a boil once it's
boiling
I'm to simmer it until the apples get
very very soft stirring occasionally
they'll take about 40 minutes it's been
about 40 minutes the apples are nice and
soft so you can see I'll give them a
stir and they're just kind of breaking
down which is perfect so now it's ready
to puree I'm going to use a food mill
for a very smooth texture but if you
want a chunkier puree you can use
something like a medium mesh sieve
that'll work great to remove this
and I'll give you more texture to the
applesauce look at this beautiful pink
color all from those skins so nice not
to have to peel those apples and you get
the benefit of the color which is so
great it smells wonderful just like fall
okay keep loading it up so there's six
pounds of apples will give us about six
and a half cups of apple sauce which is
not going to last long in my family
there you have it now into the jars
this will keep about a week in the
refrigerator or you can process it and
can it and hold it on your shelf for up
to a year I like to use a funnel when I
fill jars like this makes it very easy
and mess-free let's ladle it in okay
look how beautiful that is it's so pink
and pretty an apple sauce is so great on
its own or in a lot of different recipes
there we have it three beautiful jars of
apple sauce I need to give this a try
let's see
heart and fresh so a police so good so
in about one hour no peeling just
cutting simmering and puree you have all
this wonderful apple sauce give it a try
